item.title: Intel gathering from the interview process
item.description: While job interviews help employers evaluate candidates, they also allow candidates to assess the company’s openness, reliability, and priorities by observing the interview process and the balance of technical, soft skill, and product-oriented questions.

item.title: Leadership Lessons from Parenting
item.description: Lessons learned from interacting with children, such as keeping promises, encouraging decision-making, explaining reasoning, listening actively, understanding motivations, and setting positive examples, are directly applicable to effective leadership.

item.title: Beyond Fixed Sprint Duration
item.description: Fixed sprint durations may initially help maintain progress, but teams should consider flexible, natural rhythms and explore alternatives like Kanban to improve productivity and better align with varying task requirements.
